comments:
I used exported plugins from the workspace from today (20020408). When I launch
eclipse with a fresh workspace, I get the following log. As a consequence I
cannot launch eclipse out of eclipse.

The exact same plugins work fine on w2k.

The latest plug-ins will not work unless PDE has also been updated to honor the 
new/changed launch config API. However this is a different bug. As a work 
around can you create a new launch config?

Claude, please zip up and email me the workspace that caused this problem as 
soon as you get a chance.  Thanks.

ok, I was wrong with the fresh workspace thing. I just happens with my current 
workspace. This might actually be related to a bug related to PDE (13011).
These two problems appeared together on my Linux box.

If I try to edit launch configurations in my fresh workspace, I don't see the
workbench launch configuration. So I assume that with the fixed PDE plugin, 
this would not occure.

The workspace causing this is like 100 MB...

Email from Claude:

I figured that I can easily reproduce this problem: 

?1) I created a new 
workspace with 20020328-I. 
?2) I launched 20020404-I with latest exported plugins on this 
workspace. 

I still suspect that it's because of PDE that it cannot read the workbench launch 
configurations.
Agree that this is likely caused by format change in PDE launch config.  Moving to PDE for comment.

The problem still exists with 20020409. The workaround was to delete
.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.debug.core/.launches
This happens on w2k as well.

This is a side-effect of PDE changing its ID. It should not happen any more 
with new integration builds, assuming you either cleared debug metadata or 
moved to a fresh workspace.
